title.narrative: EDUCATION AND LEARNING

description.narrative: Quality evidence and partnerships for risk-informed programming and financing to ensure that girls and boys including those with disabilities complete primary and secondary with grade level learning outcomes., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: ESAR Country Offices achieve Programming Excellence (programmes are gender and equity focused, respond to humanitarian and development contexts, deliver and demonstrate results) by 2021

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Quality evidence and partnerships for risk-informed programming and financing to ensure that girls and boys including those withdisabilities complete primary and secondary with grade level learning outcomes.

description.narrative: In 2021, despite the continuation of the COVID19 pandemic with repeated waves and different variants, UNICEF ESARO Section provided the 21 Country Offices (COs) with quality evidence and partnerships required for learning continuity, enhancing equity, education in emergencies and adolescent skills. Country offices were particularly supported with resources mobilization,;guidance, advocacy documents and tools to support school reopening, bring all children back to school in a challenging environment, ensure learning continuity and address learning lost with;remedial and catch-up programs, improve and strengthen digital learning solutions, and improve gender equality and inclusive education, both in emergency and development contexts; | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/03/2022

title.narrative: Cumulative number of Regional Public Goods developed (e.g., tools, innovations, guidance, strategies, multi-country studies).(51772)
